text: <@U31A496G2> When you say concurrency control, are you asking specifically about chaincode executions ? If the question is that, then in 0.6 all the chaincode executions are serialized, and in 1.0 it is going to be concurrent.

text: <@U31A496G2> since multiple applications can be sending transactions simultaneously concurrency control can only be done on the peer side, during simulation (by executing the target chaincode) mvcc is built on the state properties touched by that chaincode execution (both read and write)
during validation (in VSCC) the mvcc is checked to root out double spending situations

Hyperledger Fabric v0.6
Can you please provide the stack trace?
yes i am putting logging for stack trace
it throws exception on last line i.e.
member.enroll(member.getEnrollmentSecret());
You need to set the EnrollmentSecret in Member
because if it is not already enrolled, it needs a secret to enroll, and you seem to provide that secret nowhere
but when i debug, there is enrollment secret in member object
btw what getMember method do ?
as it is returning enrollment secret in member object
sorry member.register set enrollmentSecret in member object
getMember() will get a member from KeyValueStore if it is already enrolled
if it is not in cache, it will create a new Member with whatever arguments you have specified
What is the value of getEnrollmentSecret()?
it gives enrollmentSecret of given user
when we call member.register it sets enrollmentSecret as well it create entry for same user in keyValStore
that is true
but if you want to enroll an existing user, you'll need to provide secret

i just want to register and enroll a new user
can you provide stack trace of the error?
you can call registerAndEnroll
